Additionally, domains currently or previously used as extensions in 3rd level domains will not be available for registration in the 2nd level. Additionally, the registrant's information is redacted for privacy, which is not uncommon, but given the domain's status, it does imply that the website may not be trustworthy. However, I need more evidence to make a final decision. I should check if there are any other red flags or scam indicators related to this domain.
observation: [{'url': 'https://answers.microsoft.com/en-us/msoffice/forum/all/found-this-at-an-online-store-how-genuine-and/673c28dc-35ca-41cb-a49b-035dc33d67d2', 'content': "There is a perpetual license that you can buy that is not a subscription. This is a one-time purchase but you don't receive the benefits of a subscription. SO it could be legitimate from the point of view of being a license, but it won't be a one-off lifetime subscription."}, {'url': 'https://malwaretips.com/blogs/overstock-sales-scam/', 'content': 'They tout unrealistic blowout apparel and goods markdowns up to 90% off to spark interest and website traffic. Common Overstock Scam Warning Signs: Extreme 90%+ discounts too good to be true. Suspicious URLs slightly differing from real sites. Amateur grammar/spelling errors. Non-working customer service contacts.'}, {'url': 'https://theblogsocieties.com/6-ways-to-spot-a-blogging-scam/', 'content': "These are automated emails that are sent to the masses. 5. They Ask You to Buy Something. If a brand came to you requesting you purchase something, there's no way it can be legitimate. Reputable brands have a budget to provide free products for campaigns or gift cards. 6. Trust Your Gut."}, {'url': 'https://malwaretips.com/blogs/factory-stock-clearance-scam-websites-explained/', 'content': "The 'Factory Stock Clearance' scam websites lure customers with attractive offers and discounts, such as 80% off or buy one get one free. They ask customers to pay with credit cards or other online payment methods, such as PayPal. However, once the payment is made, the customers either receive nothing at all, or receive counterfeit or ..."}, {'url': 'https://www.bbb.org/all/spot-a-scam/how-to-identify-a-fake-website', 'content': "Look closely at the domain name.
